title: CTRL0000082298 - Transcribed Interview of Albert Foley, (May 10, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 10:11
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
This is the deposition of Albert Foley by
the House Select Committee to investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States
Mr. Foley, can you please state your full name and spell your last name for the
And, Jeff, if you could identify yourself for the record.
I'm the investigative counsel who has been designated
by the select committee to conduct this deposition.
anyone else from the investigative staff.
We have some professional staff who are here.
We may be joined by members of the select committee, and I will acknowledge
them for the record when they join us.
My full name is Albert Sydney Foley, and last name is F, as in Frank,
They may ask questions at any point during the
Under the House's deposition rules, neither committee members nor staff may
discuss the substance of the testimony today unless and until the Committee approves its
I note, Mr. Foley, that under House rules, only you and your counsel may be
present, along with the staff from the select committee.
I'd like to confirm there's no one else present with you other than you and your
And I'll just say for the record that there are no other
representatives from other government agencies present.
side are from the select committee staff.
The only folks here on our
Although, as you heard at the start, this Webex is being recorded, the official
record of the deposition will be the transcript from the official reporter.
because of that, I just want to go over some of the standard rules, or guidance, that we
I ask for you to wait for the question, and I wait until you are finished to ask the
It's especially important given the technology that we're using, in case there's
Also, the reporter can't note nonverbal responses like shaking and
So you'll have to give a verbal response.
Mr. Foley, we ask that you just give complete answers to the best of your
clarify the question, you can ask.
reason, to stretch your legs, get a drink of water, speak with your attorney, that's fine.
If you don't know the answer, you can just say so.
take a brief lunch or snack break.
And any time if you want to take a break for whatever
As I said, I don't expect this to go all day.
My hope is to more or less be done in
If something happens and we need to stretch beyond that, we can
But I'm perfectly happy to soldier on to get it done
Under the House's rules, you may not refuse to answer a question unless that
refusal is to preserve a privilege that's recognized by the select committee.
to answer a question based on a privilege, we can move on and return to the question
later, or we can seek a ruling from the chairman of the committee on the objection.
the chairman overrules the objection, you'd be required to answer.
And, finally, Mr. Foley, I'll remind you, as we do for all of our witnesses, that it's
unlawful to provide false or materially misleading testimony to Congress and doing so
Mr. Foley, do you understand everything I've said so far?
Do you have any questions that we need to address before we get
I'd ask that you please raise your right hand and be sworn in by the official

about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth?
We're going to start today, first, by just testing out the technology here,
I'm not sure if I have the ability to share my screen.
This is how we're going to be sharing documents with you today in the form

First, I'll tell you this is a subpoena that was issued by the House select committee
Are you the Albert Foley that's named in this subpoena?
Mr. Foley, I want to acknowledge and thank for your prompt responses to
we appreciate that you've been vigilant about doing that in a timely manner.
You've produced to us a few dozen photographs and some videos, and
That said, I do just want to go through and confirm that you have -- just, sort of
the process that you went through to identify documents that were called for by the
So, as I scroll down through this, you'll probably recognize some of this:
cover letter that explains the basis for the subpoena.
And then there is this document
This has -- this is -- sort of describes the documents that the select
that you made to the United States Capitol complex on January 5th.
And I'll just broadly summarize, there are four
Number one is documents and communications that relate to a visit
Second category has to do with documents and communications that relate to
rallies or protests that were held in Washington, D.C., on January 5th or 6th.
The third category is any documents or communications that are related to the
attack on the Capitol on January 6th.
And then the fourth category is sort of a catch-all, anything that comes from those
first three categories that was in the form of documents or communications to
investigators, whether they're law enforcement or a different government agency.
So, Mr. Foley, have you made every effort to search for the items that were called
Can I ask you to briefly describe for us what you did to search for documents

So I looked back on my -- certainly on the photographs, my camera.
checked text messages, and I have my texts automatically -- and I don't know for what

have some emails -- I looked through the emails that I have.
And that's the extent of my
So you mentioned looking through text messages.
And what is the phone number that's associated with the cell phone that you
And is the phone, the physical device you searched, the same physical device
Is that the phone number that you used in December 2020 and
that you had during that time period?

It's been about 2 to 3 months ago.
I since lost my phone and replaced it.
I left it in an Uber car by mistake and

new physical device that came from that time period?

did those items come from a separate place that you downloaded them to, or did they

double check, but I believe I set it up that way just for storage purposes.

you -- what's the email account that you searched?

And if you could briefly just tell us a little bit about your educational
then went onto Tulane University, where I got a degree in mechanical engineering.
So I grew up in New Orleans, went to high school there in New Orleans and

I think there was a day where we called people, something like that.
I think it was one day, maybe two days.

I think actually it was with the first -- with the first

Atlanta-based events, including at the State Farm Arena, a November demonstration

phone and TV news, so-called news.
So I think there was a little bit of a lag, but I understood you to be

The -- you have FOX News, you have CNN as two main sources.
And then you have other talk shows.
So did you -- I'm gonna run through a list of some websites, and I'm

I think I even signed up, but I hardly even used it.
Not something that I've really used.
looked at it but not familiar with it.
